perturbation.original_text: The CELEBRITY will assist in getting a distributorship started through his      contacts and fan mail. The CELEBRITY can designate the party placed in the      distributorship direct to the Company. This distributorship will be      independent of the endorsement terms of the agreement and will remain on      going as long as the CELEBRITY maintains the annual membership fee.
perturbation.changed_text: The CELEBRITY will assist in distributor recruitment through his contacts and fan mail. The CELEBRITY can recommend potential distributors to the Company. Distributorship details will be governed by a separate agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that the distributorship remains active as long as the CELEBRITY pays the annual membership fee. The modified version removes this condition and introduces a 'separate agreement,' creating ambiguity. If other sections still refer to the annual fee, this constitutes an in-text contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
The COMPANY will give stock to the CELEBRITY which will be      restricted for one year from issuance and will be as follows:

               Monthly Sales Volume             Stock Options                --------------------             -------------                $  300,000                    300,000     shares                   600,000                    600,000     shares                 1,000,000                    1,000,000   shares      These stock options will remain in place until certificates are issued once      volumes are met as long as the CELEBRITY maintains the distributorship by      paying the annual dues of $15.00.
perturbation.changed_text: The COMPANY may, at its discretion, grant stock options to the CELEBRITY. The amount and terms of any such grant will be determined by the Company's Board of Directors.
perturbation.explanation: The original text details specific stock options tied to monthly sales volume and outlines that these stock options will remain in place as long as CELEBRITY maintains the distributorship by paying annual dues. The modified version removes the specifics and makes stock options discretionary, determined by the Board. This contradicts any other section that assumes the original stock option plan remains in effect based on sales volume and annual dues payment. Additionally, by eliminating the precise stock option grants, there is a missing clause that would create uncertainties.

perturbation.original_text: Travel arrangements and accommodations will be provided by the           COMPANY. This will be first class accommodations when available.
perturbation.changed_text: Travel arrangements and accommodations will be provided by the           COMPANY.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies first class accommodations. The modified version omits the 'first class' qualifier. If other sections of the agreement reference 'first class travel' or base reimbursement rates on first-class expenses, this omission creates an inconsistency.
